tool.name: PTPredict
tool.description: predicts the likelihood of peptides to be proteotypic via svm_model which is trained by PTModel
tool.command:
PTPredict
#if $param_in: -in $param_in #end if #if $param_out: -out $param_out #end if #if $param_svm_model: -svm_model $param_svm_model #end if #if $param_max_number_of_peptides: -max_number_of_peptides $param_max_number_of_peptides #end if #if $param_threads: -threads $param_threads #end if #if $adv_opts.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts.param_version: -version "$adv_opts.param_version" #end if #if $adv_opts.param_log: -log "$adv_opts.param_log" #end if #if $adv_opts.param_debug: -debug $adv_opts.param_debug #end if #if $adv_opts.param_no_progress: -no_progress #end if #if $adv_opts.param_force: -force #end if #if $adv_opts.param_test: -test #end if #end if

param.name: param_svm_model
param.label: svm model in libsvm format (can be produced by PTModel)

param.name: param_max_number_of_peptides
param.label: the maximum number of peptides considered at once (bigger number will lead to faster results but needs more memory)

param.name: param_threads
param.label: Sets the number of threads allowed to be used by the TOPP tool

param.name: param_version
param.label: Version of the tool that generated this parameters file

param.name: param_log
param.label: Name of log file (created only when specified)

param.name: param_no_progress
param.label: Disables progress logging to command line

param.name: param_test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

tool.help:
predicts the likelihood of peptides to be proteotypic via svm_model which is trained by PTModel
For more information, visit http://ftp.mi.fu-berlin.de/OpenMS/release-documentation/html/TOPP_PTPredict.html
